radiographic_examinations.findings: A 3-mm calcified nodule of the lingula unchanged, prominent opacifying collateral veins, clear lung bases, unremarkable liver, gallbladder, spleen, pancreas, and adrenal glands, somewhat distended gallbladder, stable atrophic appearance of kidneys, occlusion of the abdominal aorta, well-opacified extra anatomic bypass graft, colonic wall thickening of the sigmoid and distal descending colon, extraluminal collection in the left pericolic gutter remains, increased size of the collection measuring 4.6 x 3.3 cm, local inflammatory stranding worsened, no free intraperitoneal gas. In the pelvis, sigmoid colonic wall thickening not appreciably different, numerous sigmoid diverticula, small low-density fluid collection anterior to the rectum slightly smaller measuring 3.4 x 1.5 cm.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Compared to previous imaging, the collection in the left pericolic gutter increased in size from 4.3 x 2.3 cm to 4.6 x 3.3 cm. The small fluid collection anterior to the rectum decreased in size from 3.8 x 1.9 cm to 3.4 x 1.5 cm.
